1481285627488489476.text: Simply put, we must prioritize blockchain technology with American characteristics, rather than mimic China’s digital authoritarianism out of fear.

1481285626054029315.text: In order to maintain the dollar’s status as the world’s reserve currency in a digital age, it is important that the United States lead with a posture that prioritizes innovation and does not aim to compete with the private sector.

1481285624682487814.text: Any CBDC implemented by the Fed must be open, permissionless, and private. This means that any digital dollar must be accessible to all, transact on a blockchain that is transparent to all, and maintain the privacy elements of cash.

1481285623269011457.text: Requiring users to open an account at the Fed to access a United States CBDC would put the Fed on an insidious path akin to China’s digital authoritarianism.

1481285621754781707.text: Not only does this CBDC model raise “single point of failure” issues, leaving Americans’ financial information vulnerable to attack, but it could be used as a surveillance tool that Americans should never be forced to tolerate from their own government.

1481285620177809415.text: CBDCs that fail to adhere to these three basic principles could enable an entity like the Federal Reserve to mobilize itself into a retail bank, collect personally identifiable information on users, and track their transactions indefinitely.

1481285618529415168.text: As other countries, like China, develop CBDCs that fundamentally omit the benefits and protections of cash, it is more important than ever to ensure the United States’ digital currency policy protects financial privacy, maintains the dollar’s dominance, and cultivates innovation.

Never: 
❌ Restrain them

❌ Hesitate to call 9-1-1 when in doubt 
#EpilepsyAwarenessMonth

1325827663286726658.text:
If you’re helping someone with a seizure, DO:  
✅Stay close by 
✅Turn the person on their side if unconscious  
✅Move the person away from sharp or harmful objects  
✅Loosen ties or other tight clothing around the throat 
#EpilepsyAwarenessMonth

1200118994759553024.text: @CDCgov As a result, I introduced the Stemming the Tide of Rural Economic Stress and Suicide (STRESS) Act to make mental health treatment available for farmers, ranchers, & agricultural workers by reauthorizing the Farm and Ranch Stress Assistance Network (FRSAN). https://t.co/lvGNTzYo6Q

1200118901994086400.text: @CDCgov Livelihoods of those who feed, fuel & clothe the world depend on factors largely outside of their control, which can be a uniquely stressful environment. They also lack access to mental health services. In half of the U.S. counties, there is no psychiatrist or psychologist.

1200118767977738240.text: According to a 2016 @CDCGov report, people working in agriculture had one of the highest rates of suicide, due to the nature of their work and the lack of access to mental health care professionals in rural America.

1200118712067674113.text: Farm work is noble, but it can take its toll. I am proud to represent and support some of Minnesota’s rural communities, which is why I introduced the STRESS Act last Congress.

1200118563505348609.text: On Thanksgiving, it's important to remember and be grateful for those who produce all the food our families enjoy, both today and every day. Farmers and ranchers work endlessly to ensure our grocery stores are full and our children are nourished.
